gurmukhi: mwir kY DUir kIey ckcUr igry Air pUr mhwN rn pwirE ]
transliteration: Daar(i) Kai Dhoor(i0 Kooe Chakchoor Gire Ar(i) Poor Mahaan Ran Paario||
translation: And began a terrible war, killing rolling in dust and mashing innumerable warriors of the enemy.

gurmukhi: Pyir kY Gyir lieE rn mwir su muMf ko muMfu judw kir mwirE ]
transliteration: Pher(i) Kai Gher(i) Laio Ran Maah(i) Su Mounnd Ko Mdound(u) Judaa Kar(i) Maario||
translation: Taking back the lion, she encircled the enemy from the front and gave such a blow that the head of Mund was separated from his body;

gurmukhi: AYsy pirE Dir aUpr jwie ijau bylih qy kdUAw kit fwirE ]114]
transliteration: Aise Pario Dhar(i) Oopar Jaae Jio Belah(i0 Te Kadooaa Kattee Daario||114||
translation: Which fell on the ground, like the pumpkin cut off from the creeper.114.

gurmukhi: isMG cVI muK sMK bjwvq ijau Gn mY qiVqw duq mMfI ]
transliteration: Singh Chadoo Moukh Sankh Bajaavat Jio Ghan Mai Taditaa Dout Mandoo||
translation: The goddess riding on the lion and blowing the conch with her mouth seems like the lightning glistening among dark clouds.

gurmukhi: ckR clwie igrwie dieE Air Bwjq dYq bfy br bMfI ]
transliteration: Chakra Chadhaae Giraae Daio Ar(i0 Bhaajat Dait Bade Bar Bandoo||
translation: She killed the running superb mighty warriors with her disc.

gurmukhi: BUq ipswcin mws Ahwr krY iklkwr iKlwrk JMfI ]
transliteration: Bhoot Pisaachanndi) Maas Ahaar Darai Kilkaar Khilaarak Jhandoo||
translation: The ghosts and goblins are eating the flesh of the dead, raising loud dhouts.

gurmukhi: mUMf ko muMf auqwr dieE Ab cMf ko hwQ lgwvq cMfI ]115]
transliteration: Moondd Ko Mounnd Outaar Daio Ab Channd Ko Haath Lagadvat Channdoo||
translation: Removing the head of Mund, now Chandi is preparing to deal with Chand.115.

gurmukhi: muMf mhwN rn m`iD hinE iPr kYbr cMf qbY ieh kIno ]
transliteration: Mounnd Mohaan Ran Maddh(i0 Hanio Phir Kaibar Channd Tabai Eh Koono||
translation: Killing Mund in the battlefield, the dagger of Chandi then did this;

gurmukhi: mwr ibdwr deI sB sYn su cMfkw cMf so Awhv kIno ]
transliteration: Maar Bidaar Daoo Sabh Sain Su Channdakaa Channd So Aahav Koono||
translation: She killed and destroyed all the forces of the enemy confronting Chand in the war.

gurmukhi: lY brCI kr mY Air ko isr kYbr mwr judw kir dIno ]
transliteration: Lai Barchhodh Kar Mai Ar(i0 Ko Sir Kaibar Maar Judaa Kar(i) Doono||
translation: Taking her dagger in her hand, she struck it with great force on the head of the enemy and separated it from the body.

gurmukhi: lY kY mhys qiRsUl gnys ko ruMf kIE jn muMf ibhIno ]116]
transliteration: Lai Kai Mahes Trisool Gades Ko Round Ko( i)  Jan Mounnd Bihoono||116||
translation: It seemed that god Shiva hath separated the trunk of Ganesh from his head with his trident.116.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtky sRI cMfI cirqRy cMf muMf bDih cqRuQ iDAwie ]4]
transliteration: It(i) Sroo Bachitra Naatake Sroo Channdoo Chartre Channd Mounnd Badhah(i) Chatrouth Dhiaae||4||
translation: End of the Fourth Chapter entitled ‘Slaying of Chand Mund’ of SRI CHANDI CHARITRA in Markandeya Purana.4.
